original: Back, Carl EmM, vicekonsul, Västervik, f. 14/9/69 i Västervik av sjökapt. Carl B. o. Emma Sofia Nilsson. G. 99 m. Emmy Jansson. Barn: Arvid f. 00. — Efter lärov:stud. i Västervik t. 87 aff :anst. i Chicago t. 89, därefter egen affär i Västervik t. 39, huv:deläg. i Västerviks Posten 99-07, verkst. dir. där samma tid, red. f. Glas o. Porslin 32, niedarb. i denna tidskr. o. i Köpmannen. Sign.: Caleb. Danm. vicekonsul sed. 15. Ordf. i Västerviks Sparbank 08-45, fd. v. ordf. i styr. f. Sv. Hand :bankens avd:kont. i Västervik, led. av styr. o. ordf. i Kalmar 1. köpmannaförb. 11-41, led. av stads-fullm., fd. led. av drätselkamm., led. av centr :istyr. f. Sv:es köpmannaförb. 13-41, av styr. f. Västerviks Stuv. A-B, ordf. i brandstyr. o. Tjusts Nya Ångf. A-B. OM i Frimurarlogen Eystra- salt 32-44. RVO 28, RDDO, 2 GM, 1 SM.
translated: Back, Carl EmM, vice-consul, Västervik, born on September 14th, 1869 in Västervik to the sea captain Carl B. and Emma Sofia Nilsson. Married in 1899 to Emmy Jansson. They have one child: Arvid, born in 1900. After finishing school in Västervik in 1887, he worked in business in Chicago until 1889. He then started his own business in Västervik, which he operated until 1939. He was a major shareholder in the Västerviks Posten newspaper from 1899 to 1907 and was managing director during that period. He was also the editor of Glas o. Porslin in 1932 and contributed to the tidskr and Köpmannen. His pseudonym was Caleb. He was appointed Danish vice-consul in 1915. Back was chairman of the board of directors for the Västerviks Sparbank from 1908 to 1945, and was vice-chairman of the board of directors for the Svenska Handelsbanken branch in Västervik. He was a member of the city council, former member of the committee of finance, and member and chairman of the board of the Kalmar Trade Association from 1911 to 1941. He was also a member and chairman of the central board of the Swedish Trade Association from 1913 to 1941, a member of the board of directors for Västerviks Stuv. A-B, chairman of the Fire Department, and Tjusts Nya Ångf. A-B. He was a member of the Freemasonry Lodge Eystra-salt from 1932 to 1944 and was awarded several medals, including the Order of the Polar Star in 1928, RDDO, 2 GM, and 1 SM.
